documentation.text:
@title AMFEIX ERC20 swap smart contract
 @dev Contract based on ERC20 standard with "swap" features between BTC and AMF

@dev Sets the values for {name} and {symbol}, initializes {decimals} with
 a default value of 18.
 All three of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during
 construction.

@dev Allows anyone to destroy its tokens.
 @param amount The number of tokens that sender is willing to burn from its account

@dev Returns the current swap ratio (how much AMF tokens corresponds to 1 BTC)
      
 Initial ratio  100000 AMF : 1 BTC  (1 AMF : 1000 sat)
 We need this value to compute the amount of AMF to send to users when they deposited BTC at AMFEIX
 and to compute the amount of BTC to send to users when they claim back their BTC.

@dev Allows contract owner to update the current swap ratio (AMF/BTC).
 
 @param newRatio The updated amount of AMF tokens corresponding to 1 BTC (~10^5)

attributes.text:
@title AMFEIX ERC20 swap smart contract
 @dev Contract based on ERC20 standard with "swap" features between BTC and AMF

@dev Sets the values for {name} and {symbol}, initializes {decimals} with
 a default value of 18.
 All three of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during
 construction.

@dev Allows anyone to destroy its tokens.
 @param amount The number of tokens that sender is willing to burn from its account

@dev Returns the current swap ratio (how much AMF tokens corresponds to 1 BTC)
      
 Initial ratio  100000 AMF : 1 BTC  (1 AMF : 1000 sat)
 We need this value to compute the amount of AMF to send to users when they deposited BTC at AMFEIX
 and to compute the amount of BTC to send to users when they claim back their BTC.

@dev Allows contract owner to update the current swap ratio (AMF/BTC).
 
 @param newRatio The updated amount of AMF tokens corresponding to 1 BTC (~10^5)

devdoc.details: Contract based on ERC20 standard with "swap" features between BTC and AMF

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

btcDelivery(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Allows contract owner to notify the network that BTC has been paid to claiming user

params.btcAmount: Amount of BTC paid to claiming user
params.customer: Ethereum address of the claiming user
params.ethTxId: Transaction ID of the token transfer from user to AMFEIX pool

burn(uint256).details: Allows anyone to destroy its tokens.

params.amount: The number of tokens that sender is willing to burn from its account

claimBTC(uint256,string).details: Allow any customer who hold tokens to claim BTC

params.tokenAmount: Amount of tokens to be exchanged (needs to be multiplied by 10^18)
params.userBtcAddress: BTC address on which users willing to receive payment /!\ gas cost for calling this method : 37kgas /!\

constructor.details: Sets the values for {name} and {symbol}, initializes {decimals} with a default value of 18. All three of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during construction.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getBtcToAmfRatio().details: Returns the current swap ratio (how much AMF tokens corresponds to 1 BTC)       Initial ratio  100000 AMF : 1 BTC  (1 AMF : 1000 sat) We need this value to compute the amount of AMF to send to users when they deposited BTC at AMFEIX and to compute the amount of BTC to send to users when they claim back their BTC.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

mint(address,uint256).details: Allows contract owner to create new tokens.

params.amount: The number of tokens the recipient will receive

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setBtcToAmfRatio(uint256).details: Allows contract owner to update the current swap ratio (AMF/BTC).

params.newRatio: The updated amount of AMF tokens corresponding to 1 BTC (~10^5)

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

tokenDelivery(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Allows contract owner to notify the network that a user who deposited       BTC at AMFEIX has it ETH wallet funded with the equivalent amount of tokens

params.btcTxId: Transaction ID of the BTC deposit
params.tokenAmount: Amount of token to deliver to user
params.userEthAddress: Ethereum address previously provided by user through an OP_RETURN on bitcoin

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: AMFEIX ERC20 swap smart contract
